title.narrative: OTP 3: EQUITY YOUNG CHILD WELLBEING

description.narrative: By 2017, integrated quality services that promote young children's well-being and development are delivered by the primary health care system, education and protection systems in cooperation with local public authorities and civil society., which contributes to Early Learning, Health â€“ General, Hiv â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition â€“ General, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the Government addresses disparities in access to quality education, health, protection and justice services for disadvantaged children and families.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2017, integrated quality services that promote young children?s well-being and development are delivered by the primary healthcare system, education and protection systems in cooperation with local public authorities and civil society.

description.narrative: With UNICEF technical support the Guideline of Home visiting for Young Children was approved, a Communication Strategy and Action Plan to promote immunization was adopted and access to high quality vaccines was ensured through procurements from UNICEF Supply Division. Capacities of 384 health professionals on interpersonal communication were built. | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/01/2018
